name: 0x18
description:
A grid with 256 x 256 pixels x 256 colors x 256 frames.

256 pixels in each of the 256 colors at every frame, and each pixel goes from color 1 to color 256 linearly.

The distribution of the pixels changes in each piece based on a sequence of simple mathematical transformations. The pixels are recombined in a different resolution with the same area. Half of it is inverted, then reconverted to 256 x 256. This procedure can be repeated up to 8 times.

Out of those straightforward steps and strict rules, highly complex and completely distinct patterns emerge.

256x256x256x256 is a generative series created by Leston (@matheusleston)
